verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician,<s%> A <S%H4210>Psalm<s%> of <S%H1732>David.<s%> <S%H2790>Hold<s%> <S%H408>not<s%> thy peace, O <S%H430>God<s%> of my <S%H8416>praise;<s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> the <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> and the <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of the <S%H4820>deceitful<s%> are <S%H6605>opened<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> me: they have <S%H1696>spoken<s%> <S%H854>against<s%> me with a <S%H8267>lying<s%> <S%H3956>tongue.<s%>
They compassed me <S%H5437>about<s%> also with <S%H1697>words<s%> of <S%H8135>hatred;<s%> and fought <S%H3898>against<s%> me without a <S%H2600>cause.<s%>
For <S%H8478><s%> my <S%H160>love<s%> they are my <S%H7853>adversaries:<s%> but <S%H589>I<s%> give myself unto <S%H8605>prayer.<s%>
And they have <S%H7760>rewarded<s%> <S%H5921><s%> me <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H8478>for<s%> <S%H2896>good,<s%> and <S%H8135>hatred<s%> <S%H8478>for<s%> my <S%H160>love.<s%>
Set <S%H6485><s%> thou a wicked <S%H7563>man<s%> <S%H5921>over<s%> him: and let <S%H7854>Satan<s%> <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H5921>at<s%> his right <S%H3225>hand.<s%>
When he shall be <S%H8199>judged,<s%> let him be <S%H3318>condemned:<s%> <S%H7563><s%> and <S%H3318>let<s%> his <S%H8605>prayer<s%> <S%H1961>become<s%> <S%H2401>sin.<s%>
Let his <S%H3117>days<s%> <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H4592>few;<s%> and let <S%H312>another<s%> <S%H3947>take<s%> his <S%H6486>office.<s%>
Let his <S%H1121>children<s%> <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H3490>fatherless,<s%> and his <S%H802>wife<s%> a <S%H490>widow.<s%>

Let his <S%H1121>children<s%> be continually <S%H5128>vagabonds,<s%> <S%H5128><s%> and <S%H7592>beg:<s%> let them <S%H1875>seek<s%> their bread also out of their desolate <S%H4480>places.<s%> <S%H2723><s%>
Let the <S%H5383>extortioner<s%> <S%H5367>catch<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> <S%H834>that<s%> he hath; and let the <S%H2114>strangers<s%> <S%H962>spoil<s%> his <S%H3018>labor.<s%>

Let there <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H408>none<s%> to <S%H4900>extend<s%> <S%H2617>mercy<s%> unto him: <S%H408>neither<s%> let there <S%H1961>be<s%> any to <S%H2603>favor<s%> his fatherless <S%H3490>children.<s%>
Let his <S%H319>posterity<s%> <S%H1961>be<s%> cut <S%H3772>off;<s%> and in the <S%H1755>generation<s%> <S%H312>following<s%> let their <S%H8034>name<s%> be blotted <S%H4229>out.<s%>

Let the <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> of his <S%H1>fathers<s%> be <S%H2142>remembered<s%> <S%H413>with<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD;<s%> and let <S%H408>not<s%> the <S%H2403>sin<s%> of his <S%H517>mother<s%> be blotted <S%H4229>out.<s%>
Let them <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H5048>before<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H8548>continually,<s%> that he may cut <S%H3772>off<s%> the <S%H2143>memory<s%> of them from the <S%H4480>earth.<s%> <S%H776><s%>

Because <S%H3282><s%> <S%H834>that<s%> he <S%H2142>remembered<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> to <S%H6213>show<s%> <S%H2617>mercy,<s%> but <S%H7291>persecuted<s%> the <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H34>needy<s%> <S%H376>man,<s%> that he might even <S%H4191>slay<s%> the <S%H3512>broken<s%> in <S%H3824>heart.<s%>

As he <S%H157>loved<s%> <S%H7045>cursing,<s%> so let it <S%H935>come<s%> unto him: as he <S%H2654>delighted<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> in <S%H1293>blessing,<s%> so let it be <S%H7368>far<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> him.

As he <S%H3847>clothed<s%> himself with <S%H7045>cursing<s%> like as with his <S%H4055>garment,<s%> so let it <S%H935>come<s%> into his <S%H7130>bowels<s%> like <S%H4325>water,<s%> and like <S%H8081>oil<s%> into his <S%H6106>bones.<s%>
Let it <S%H1961>be<s%> unto him as the <S%H899>garment<s%> which <S%H5844>covereth<s%> him, and for a <S%H4206>girdle<s%> wherewith he is <S%H2296>girded<s%> <S%H8548>continually.<s%>

Let <S%H2063>this<s%> be the <S%H6468>reward<s%> of mine <S%H7853>adversaries<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H854><s%> the <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> and of them that <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> my <S%H5315>soul.<s%>

But <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H859>thou<s%> <S%H854>for<s%> me, O <S%H3069>GOD<s%> the <S%H136>Lord,<s%> for thy name's <S%H4616>sake:<s%> <S%H8034><s%> <S%H3588>because<s%> thy <S%H2617>mercy<s%> is <S%H2896>good,<s%> <S%H5337>deliver<s%> thou me.
For <S%H3588><s%> <S%H595>I<s%> am <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H34>needy,<s%> and my <S%H3820>heart<s%> is <S%H2490>wounded<s%> <S%H7130>within<s%> me.
I am <S%H1980>gone<s%> like the <S%H6738>shadow<s%> when it <S%H5186>declineth:<s%> I am tossed up and <S%H5287>down<s%> as the <S%H697>locust.<s%>
My <S%H1290>knees<s%> are <S%H3782>weak<s%> through <S%H4480>fasting;<s%> <S%H6685><s%> and my <S%H1320>flesh<s%> <S%H3584>faileth<s%> of <S%H4480>fatness.<s%> <S%H8081><s%>
I <S%H589><s%> <S%H1961>became<s%> also a <S%H2781>reproach<s%> unto them: when they looked <S%H7200>upon<s%> me they <S%H5128>shaked<s%> their <S%H7218>heads.<s%>
Help <S%H5826><s%> me, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> my <S%H430>God:<s%> O <S%H3467>save<s%> me according to thy mercy: <S%H2617><s%>
That <S%H3588><s%> they may <S%H3045>know<s%> that <S%H2063>this<s%> is thy <S%H3027>hand;<s%> that <S%H859>thou,<s%> <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> hast <S%H6213>done<s%> it.

Let <S%H1992>them<s%> <S%H7043>curse,<s%> but <S%H1288>bless<s%> <S%H859>thou:<s%> when they <S%H6965>arise,<s%> let them be <S%H954>ashamed;<s%> but let thy <S%H5650>servant<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice.<s%>
Let mine <S%H7853>adversaries<s%> be <S%H3847>clothed<s%> with <S%H3639>shame,<s%> and let them <S%H5844>cover<s%> themselves with their own <S%H1322>confusion,<s%> as with a <S%H4598>mantle.<s%>
I will <S%H3966>greatly<s%> <S%H3034>praise<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> with my <S%H6310>mouth;<s%> yea, I will <S%H1984>praise<s%> him <S%H8432>among<s%> the <S%H7227>multitude.<s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> he shall <S%H5975>stand<s%> at the right <S%H3225>hand<s%> of the <S%H34>poor,<s%> to <S%H3467>save<s%> him from those that <S%H4480>condemn<s%> <S%H8199><s%> his <S%H5315>soul.<s%>
